headline: Land of Nod Cinnamon Buns
description: Easy to make overnight cinnamon rolls, perfect for young cooks and people on the go.
name: Land of Nod Cinnamon Buns

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly grease a 10 inch Bundt cake pan. Place frozen rolls into pan and sprinkle with brown sugar, pudding mix, ground cinnamon and raisins. Pour melted butter over rolls. Cover with a clean, damp cloth and leave overnight at room temperature.
In the morning, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bake rolls for 25 minutes, until golden brown. Turn rolls out onto a serving plate and serve warm.

review.reviewBody: My kids said it looks like a Bundt cake But it's not a Bundt cake My kids say it looks good And I do too
I leave out the raisins, but my kids love these!
Excellent! Made it for Christmas morning breakfast and the kids loved it! It is so easy to prep the night before. We will make this every year from now on.
My tweaks: 13 x 9 pan, 1 T cinnamon, lots of nuts and 30 minutes in the oven Perfect!
This is my favorite recipe for cinnamon buns. It’s super easy and taste amazing. I also include pecans when making the recipe.
This was amazing and so easy the whole family loved it!!!
I use butterscotch cook and serve pudding instead of vanilla. It’s easy... sprinkle on with the brown sugar. I also cut the sugar in half.
Try placing chopped pecans in the bottom of the pan. I used butterscotch instant pudding powder in place of vanilla and it was awesome.

My recipe is similar, with a few differences that address some of the negative comments I’ve read:

1) I use 1/2 - 1 c. melted butter
2) 1 tbsp cinnamon (more or less depending on your taste) 
3) Raisins and walnuts to taste....I just sprinkle over the buns until it looks ok..but much less than 3/4 cup.
4) Place half of the buns in a sprayed bundt pan. Sprinkle with half of the other ingredients. Repeat layer. Cover with damp cloth. Leave on counter overnight.

In the morning, bake at 350o for 30-40 minutes or until lightly golden brown on top. Invert on a serving plate. Let stand 3 minutes. Remove bundt pan. Enjoy!
This is a family favorite! I omit the raisins and use a 1/2 cup(1full stick) butter.
No changes. Have made for 20 years. Always good except for differences in breD rolls you get from grocer. I'm not a baker so far,ily approval and makes again please, is huge.
We make this every Christmas eve to eat on Christmas morning. So good. Never met someone who didn't love this.

I have made this amazing recipe for years, I got it from a friend. The only frozen buns available tome here are a little bigger so I use 17 of them instead of the 20. I have assembled it in advance and before leaving it to rise I cover it with foil and freeze it and then just bring it out before I go to bead and it is perfect in the morning. I have also forgotten the cinnamon and it is still wonderful. The is a fave in our family and I have given it out many times. I agree there may be too much sugar but I don't worry about it.

These were marvelous! The only surprise I got was when I removed the damp cloth in the morning--they were enormous and were spilling out a little from my casserole dish. I would recommend using a slightly bigger casserole dish than you would put the frozen rolls in. 

The end result was wonderful! I made a batch with white icing and a batch with chopped pecans. They were both a huge hit, so thank you!
This was so fast and easy. My Grandchildren loved it!
I don't enjoy a lot of sweets but our overnight guests and my boyfriend didn't leave any for me. It was super easy to make.

Will make this over & over! Made the recipe to the tee... but... don't get me wrong I love sweet stuff, I think next will decrease brown sugar just a bit. There was a awful lot of the thick "crunchy" mixture in the bottom of pan & me & family were on a sugar buzz for a while after these. These were great & easy!
Big hit! I made this with flacky honey biscuit, I did not find the rolls and cut 1/4 of the sugar due to the honey. Perfect, thanks!!

I took these to work and everyone raved and loved them!!!! I used butterscotch pudding mix instead and pecans instead of raisins. Also couldn't find frozen dinner rolls so used 2 loaves of frozen bread dough. I thawed them for a little bit on the counter and then sliced them into about 8 slices per loaf. I think next time I will slice them even more to make it more like a pull apart bread.
Has become a Christmas morning tradition at my house. Quick, easy, and delicious!
Made this for Christmas morning...the whole family loved it! Easy and delicious!!!
This recipe is amazing. I am kitchen-illiterate and this recipe made me look like a pro! Everyone loved it!

Love, LOVE, LOVE this recipe. I don't put the pudding mix in, find it gives it a 'commercial' taste, just the brown sugar and cinnamon is the best, I bake them a little longer so the buns in the center aren't so gooey, if the outside buns get to brown I cover it with tin foil, every special occasion calls for these buns, sooooo delicious
This is great to make the night before, when you have guests in the house! Simply Delicious!
Easy and so good! I like to omit the raisins and drizzle with a cream cheese frosting. Yum!

I get so excited when a new recipe turns out as well as this one did! Don't change a thing! I can't believe how beautiful, easy and delicious this was! My only regret is that I didn't get a picture of this masterpiece before my guests devoured it!

For everyone that's confused about "sprinkle the pudding mix", think about it. It's pretty clear on what you need to do...sprinkle...the...pudding...mix. Not make the pudding. Why would anyone sprinkle a made pudding...that doesn't even make sense.

This was so easy and so delicious! It would be easy to add nuts as well. I didn't read that it has to sit overnight so I ended up having them ready for dinner rather than breakfast, but they were still just as tastey! Don't let them sit too long or the buns will rise and overflow. Thanks for sharing this!

OK this will be a new Christmas morning tradition in our house, so easy and DELICIOUS! I followed the recipie pretty much, ecept I rolled the rolls in the cinnamon and the vanilla pudding mix and then dumped the extra on top. Melted 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup butter and poured over the top. Next time I will try with Pecans and I many try cutting the rolls in half..... just to keep me from eating so much! :)

I prepare this EXACTLY and it turns out perfectly every time. It goes perfectly when I'm making a slow-cooker meal because I can toss it together in the morning at the same time and it's ready for me to bake it that evening. This recipe is actually in a published "allrecipes" book, fyi.

Mine did not look like the picture at all. It rose way too high, and all the cinnamon sank to the bottom (which ended up being the top after you flipped it.) Then as it cooled it deflated. I layered sugar and butter on bottom, middle and top - so I'm not sure how I could do it different next time? Obviously I'll need to let it rise less. It was 12 hours by the time we got it in the oven. Hmmm, I really want to get this to work.
Excellent flavor, very simple to make!
I have made this for about 10 years, or so. I was given the recipe by a friend, but they called it "Sticky Mickeys" as it was a recipe from Disney World. Great, easy recipe!!!!

first of all, let's give credit to the Best of Bridge cookbooks that this recipe came out of. Secondly, I have prepared this recipe no less than 100 times, and except for the time I apparently had a little too much egg nog on Xmas eve and forgot the melted butter....it never fails!! I usually add pecans. This has been used for over 25 years in our house for Xmas, birthday sleepovers, family brunch. I would NEVER make it for just my husband and myself now! I'd eat the whole thing!

Absolutely SUPER! Used a 9x13 pan cause I don't have a bunt pan and only made 12. Turned out fantastic and I got a big hug from my daughter for making her fresh cinnamon buns in the morning. No need to tell her it was no trouble at all right?
Very good and so easy to make! I did tweak the recipe a bit and used more butter and added a little nutmeg. Definitely becoming a favorite in our household!

LOVE this recipe! I've made it a few times and always get great responses. For the rolls, I make a dough in my bread machine, form it into 16 rolls, freeze for a couple of hrs. on a cookie sheet, then follow recipe. I also make a simple icing of icing sugar and milk and drizzle that on top after baking. Thanks for this yummy and simple recipe!
very good cinnamon buns. The same recipe was on the bun package as well as making cheese buns in the same manner

I have been having these buns for years as a family tradition on Christmas morning. It's easy and so tasty! I'm teaching my children how to prepare them now, the same way my mother taught me. I usually just place my buns in the oven to rise over night, even if they overrise it has never effected to flavours of the buns
I make this around the holidays. It is so easy and so delicious. My family just loves this one! Thanks!

These were good, but I don't think I would make them again due to the extreme sweetness that has made me a bit ill...lol. I did have to bake them longer than stated as the ones in the middle of the 13 x 9 pan weren't cooked through. I didn't have a bundt pan, so I did use the 13 x 9, but I might suggest using less dinner rolls as they rise like crazy!

Yummy. I couldn't find the rolls so I used one loaf of bread dough. I thawed it in the fridge for a few hours then cut it into about 12 peices, then followed the rest of the recipes exactly as described. This is a new Christmas breaskfast tradition at our house.

This recipes was delicious, but I think one small change would improve it a great deal. If you sprinkle 1/3 of the sugar mixture in before the dough goes in, then only add 1/2 the dough, then 1/3 more of the mixture, then the remaining dough and remaining sugar, that would eliminate a problem that I ran into - a lot of the sugar and raisins ended up clumped together at the bottom after you turn it out onto a serving plate rather than evenly spread throughout the dish. It was still delicious though, and so easy!

We've had this every Christmas morning for the past 3 years and LOVE it! I love that it's egg-free, and can be made to taste (and health ;) ) so it's a good treat for young kids. It's so so easy, too - I throw it together quickly the night before, stick it in the oven before the kids open presents, and it's done when they are - perfect!! Thanks so much for a great recipe!

they were okay. Maybe I did something wrong. They came out HUGE and half the filling fell to the bottom of the oven. They weren't gooey like I expected either. Will possibly try again with fewer rolls and melt the sugar and butter together.
I make this every Christmas Eve and Easter - it's been a tradition since I've found the recipe years ago. THANK YOU!

Great fun. A collection of easy-to-use ingredients, and a make-ahead recipe. Great when you are having company for breakfast or brunch- they give the impression that you have been up baking for hours...

This is a wonderful recipe. The only thing I would suggest, is that you use "Freshly Bought" frozen rolls. If you have some in the freezer too long, they dont rise as they should. Otherwise, the recipe is a real keeper. Thanks for sharing.
This is wonderful. When we have overnight guests, this is always a simple breakfast and so delicious! I use pecans instead of raisins simply because I love them!
I grew up on these and they are wonderful. Only difference is nuts instead of raisins. Absolutely wonderful breakfast!
Very easy and delicious!!! I was a little confused if you were suppose to make the pudding before hand...I just used the powder form and it turned out great!!!! I will make this again for sure.

Really delicious recipe. I took it a step further and dipped each roll in melted butter and then rolled them in the sugar mixture. Yummy! I also placed mine in a tube pan since many people had the problem of them rising out of their bundt pans...this worked like a charm -- a perfect fit.

This recipe is delicious and embarassingly easy! I've made in the bundt pan, but it rose over the pan during the night. I baked with a baking sheet underneath just to be sure. The last time I tried in a 9x13 pan, and it worked perfectly. Rich, buttery and divine. This one's a keeper!
I have been making these for years....most frozen dinner rolls contain 24 rolls....use them all! This is a warm, cozy Sunday morning, cup of coffee kind of food.....try them

I made these two weekends in a row. The first weekend for seven people and the next for 16. Both times I couldn't make enough. I mixed the brown sugar mixture well and put one row of rolls on the bottom of the pan then the mixture then another row of rolls. I also used the icing recipe from another reviewer and they were spectacular. This recipe also works by separating the rolls into two cake pans.
By far the easiest and tastiest recipe I've ever made for Christmas brunch !!!

Delicious, easy breakfast treat! I made these Christmas morning for my fiance and our roomate and they got gobbled up. I panicked because I didn't have a bunt pan (thought I did, must have wandered off somewhere...) so I made it in a shallow, glass casserole dish. Only problem was that it rose so much that the buns stuck to the damp towel. I would use a deeper dish next time.
I omited the raisins because I don't like them and drizzled my own cream cheese icing over them when they were warm - mmmm, mmm good!
Every time I've made this it goes quickly. However I do only put about 16 of the grands frozen biscuits in it or else the top burns before the center is done.
Sinful and Easy! I make this often with and without the raisins! Have used Caramel pudding and White Chocolate all of which are fabulous!
This was proberly one of the easiest and best recipe i have done. I make it for most holiday mornings and even before my family goes off for the day. The taste and texture are amazing.

I'm a little torn on this one. First of all, my dough overflowed my pan overnight! I don't know why. I followed the recipe exactly. It was a little underdone after 25 minutes. I use an oven thermometer, so I know I had the temp. right. I'm not sure. It didn't have the texture or taste I was hoping for. Thanks for posting!

This was great and easy! Nice to be able to put together the night before. I used a large package of pudding and a little more butter than called for in the recipe. I also cut the dough into smaller pieces so you had more to pull apart. I layered the dough and ingredients so all pieces had the good stuff, no dry bread. The family loved it!
Been using a recipe just like this for years now - a huge favorite for every holiday brunch. Easy and my kids love to help make it. I sometimes use butterscotch pudding but I prefer the vanilla.
Awesome recipe. It is sooooo quick and easy and tastes amazing. Definately a hit with friends and family.

I made this Christmas morning - hoping it would turn out because I hadn't tried it before. It was perfect! I had to use an 8x8 pan because I didn't have a bundt pan but it worked great, thanks for the recipe!
I have been making this recipe for several years (ever since finding it here!). Very good and always a hit!

These were so good and so easy!! We put them together Christmas Eve night and breakfast was ready before everyone got up Christmas morning. The only downside was the cinnamon seemed to be hit and miss - although we also left them in the pan rather than turning them out to help them stay warm. Still a wonderful, and wonderfully easy treat!
Incredibly easy and were a big hit this Christmas morning with the family!
I am confused, do you prepare the pudding mix? Or just use the powder? I have tried it both ways!
I used butterscotch pudding mix, omitted raisins and used chopped English walnuts instead. Yummy and caramel-y...deelish!!

This is a family tradition at our house. I make this on Christmas Eve and keep in the fridge overnight (to prevent over-rising). Christmas morning I let it set at room temperature for 45 minutes, or until double. I use Rhodes Frozen Roll dough 24 and cut them in half. Roll them in the dry cook and serve pudding.(sprinkle remaining dry pudding over the top of rolls). I melt 1/2 C. butter and 1/2 C brown sugar in the microwave to make a syrup and pour that over the top. This recipe is fabulous, thank you for sharing!

Wow! These are amazing! It's our new Christmas and holiday breakfast tradition. I use 1/2 cup of butter, otherwise they're a little dry. I also use less frozen rolls, about 12, so they have more goo. Try it with cream cheese frosting-yummy!
This is good. I use homemade rolls.
I have been making these for years, they are a favourite in my family. It is a no-fail recipe with amazing taste. Serve it with fruit salad, o.j. and coffee and it makes for an easy brunch.
Excellent and very easy! I did use pecans instead of raisins. They were a big hit. I also had to bake them a tad longer. This is a definite keeper!
soooo easy, everyone loves it!!
Great! i omitted the cinnamon and the flour and it turned out perfect!
USE MORE BUTTER! I found my brown sugar mix did not melt.
This is easy and delicious. The two main ingredients I like. Absolutely wonderful sweet rolls. I get complimented on them every time.

I made this for Christmas morning and my family just loved them. I made the glaze suggested by one of the reviewers and they were excellent. The recipe is supposed to serve 12 and 6 of us finished them in one meal. I can't believe how easy they were. I highly recommend them!
I made these for a sleep over for my daughter and her friends and they enjoyed them.

I was expecting alot more "gooey and rich". The kids loved them and they went over well, but I think it needs more of the topping. It would be interesting to try doubling the topping and see how it would work. Like other post I used thawed frozen bread dough and cut it into little pieces and allowed it to rise for a couple of hours. So quick and easy to do.
fun to do w/kids ! taste good but could have used more topping ! Every one ate it !
These were AMAZING!! I followed the recipe to a Tee..and they turned out awesome. Made them for Sunday Brunch and my guests ate 'em all up!! Definately will be making these again and again!!

These were so easy and fantastic. I added 3/4 c. chopped walnuts and put them in pan first. I also used 1/2 c. butter and made a glaze for the top that I added right before serving. The glaze was 1 c. sifted powdered sugar, 1t. vanilla extract, & 1+ T. Milk. I kept adding milk until I reached the right "drizzling" consistency.
Yummmmm and soooo easy. Great to make on Saturday night and have ready for a lazy sunday morning breakfast.
These are great, however, I prefer to use butterscotch pudding mix instead of vanilla. Try it!
I thought this was OUTSTANDING! I have made this recipie twice now, once with raisins and once without raisins...and both ways are GREAT!

Yummy! However, I'm not sure why some thought these were too sweet. I didn't use raisins so that might be partly why I didn't get that overwhelmingly sweet taste. I cut down on the sugar and added more butter but wished I had more of the topping so next time I will add all the sugar and add a little more butter. The good thing about the topping is that it runs off when you turn the buns out of the pan, then you can just pour as much of that mixture as you like back onto the buns. I did use the icing recipe from the "Clone of a Cinnabon" recipe from this site. For that I would add a little more milk so that it doesn't get stiff like cake icing. Then I was trying to get the same taste as the Caramel Pecanbon from Cinnabon, so after I put the white icing on, I drizzled a little caramel over that and topped with pecans. It was too good to be so easy! This would make a great addition to a brunch menu. However, I'll probably cut the recipe in half when I make it just for my family as it made quite a bit.

These were good but they lacked something. I think they need more butter and less brown sugar. I would definitely recommend adding about 2/3 cup brown sugar instead of 1 cup so they aren't overpoweringly sweet! I would even suggest trying a powdered sugar frosting in place of the pudding mix. Anyways, with a few corrections, I think they would be great. They are very easy though and they would be fun to make with kids. I do give 5 stars for the name of the cinnamon buns!
Easy and delicious - I'm thrilled that I can have such great tasting cinnamon rolls w/o having to deal with yeast and flour. Will make many more times I'm sure.

Very good recipe! If you use frozen bread dough - ONE loaf really is enough. I was doubtful and had a mess in the morning.
I used a bundt pan, decreased the brown sugar to 2/3 c., increased the pudding mix, and substituted pecans. In the future, I will use 1/2 c. brown sugar and 1/4 c. white sugar (to decrease the crunchy/hardness factor). I will put 1/2 a stick of melted butter on it the night before and add the remaining 1/2 stick that morning.
These were quick and easy, but not the best. The ratios were off, too much sugar not enough butter...I will change things up next time since they were an easy treat!
Easy, easy, easy and yummy too. The kids couldn't get enough. Will make again.

I make this recipe the night before any special occasion like Thanksgiving or Christmas day. It simply couldn't be any easier or any more fool-proof. It looks beautiful and it awesome! Try cranberries instead of raisins too!
Awesome. I left out the raisins and they were great. The easiest cinnamon buns yet!

I have been making monkey bread for years but this one is the best because of ease of making and the addition of the vanilla pudding mix! Rhodes frozen dinner rolls were fantastic in my recipe - a welcome break from canned biscuit dough. I used the quick thaw method & proofed the entire bundt after layering in the oven. (To do this, preheat to 200 degrees, microwave dough balls for 30 seconds each side; layer recipe as directed; put dough in and turn the oven OFF; wait a couple of hours; bake as directed.) I love the sprinkling & layering - so easy! Who knew??? I did use more butter. This one will be a staple at our house!
Keeper! Next time I'll reduce the amounts a little. It spilled over to the bottom of the oven.

YUMMY! Thank you Shannon. My mom had tried one something like this where you rolled the frozen dough in butter, cinn & sugar. She said it wasn't good at all. Gave her some of these fresh out of the oven and ALL agree that they are delicious! So I gave her a copy of THIS recipe. I used pecans instead of raisins. You could probably add most your favorite "add ons" to this and it would still be great. Thanks again.
